title: Explain this to me
body:
I always think it's funny when a champion gets either gutted or "fixed" by Riot (which means they become incredibly overpowered and near 100 percent banrate), people just come out of the woodwork to rage about how Riot killed their FAVORITE CHAMP

Of the slew of people complaining about Malzahar because of the fact that they used to "main" him and can no longer play him due to bans, I guarantee only like 2.5 percent of you were ACTUALLY Malz mains. You just want something to bitch about.

replies.body:
The vast majority of players do not post on the boards. In reality, even champs with a 1% play rate have THOUSANDS of dedicated and passionate players, even if they do not make themselves verbally known.

When these players become sufficiently motivated to complain, they will do so. The boards is the way to do that. That's why it seems like these people just "happen" to be mains of obscure champions, because they don't come to the boards regularly.
thank you for facilitating good discussion and answering the question i asked, upvote sir
much like you dont protest until things get bad or are announced to get bad but you don't doubt alot of people living in the city
look at my account i mained malz b4 the rework now just the idea of playing him disgust me becausei hate op champs
Oh you're one of those special snowflakes that like to play underrated champs to feel special and unique.
ohhh look what we got here, you're one of thoses special snowflakes that have to try to humiliate other peoples on a online board to feel special and unique such originalities much wow !!

Personally i agree, in the sense that, i've always hated to play the OP champions, not because they are strong, but because the champions who are OP in almost all cases require little skill or continued effort once learned, to utilize their power. 

For example, the 2nd highest ban champion right now is zed. I don't play him, not because he is strong, but rather because he's far to easy to actually use.

People seem to think that OP = Power, but they're wrong in that sense. 
OP = Power + Ease of Use.

> [{quoted}](name=Shenmue,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ot5VdiEi,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-05-16T18:19:08.688+0000)
>
> look at my account i mained malz b4 the rework now just the idea of playing him disgust me becausei hate op champs

Hes not OP =/ 

He has good objective-focused clears. Hes the epitome of a farm jungler at this point, as his ganks suck pre-six and it takes a laner capable of killing their opponent in the 2.5s window because your damage is quite low.

Honestly i actually use to main malzahar, don't get me wrong i played just about every champion, but my 2nd highest mastery champion has < 1/2 of the points. 

If you think the people who "used to main him" are angry at not being able to play him due to his high ban rate, then you're sorely mistaken. 

The majority of the people coming onto the forums posting about no longer being able to play him isn't because he's ban, it's because he's not fun to play anymore. I don't even play ranked, and i no longer play the champion. It's just not fun to do so now that they've gutted the complexity of his kit, and redistributed the majority of his power to a skill which, basically, automatically kills the target.
People bitch about anything and everything :P
Former Morde main here, I'm sure you can guess where I was when Morde was butchered

But... I am a Malzahar main.. {{champion:90}} 

Forever and always.
